services package

Submodules

services.customer_service module

services.customer_service.authenticate_customer(username, password)[source]

Authenticate a customer using username and password.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The customer’s username.

  • password (str) – The customer’s password.

Returns:

The customer object if authentication is successful, else None.

Return type:

Customer

services.customer_service.charge_wallet(username, amount)[source]

Charge a customer’s wallet by a specific amount.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet.

Raises:

ValueError – If the customer is not found or the amount is invalid.

Returns:

The updated wallet balance.

Return type:

float

services.customer_service.deduct_wallet(username, amount)[source]

Deduct a specific amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct.

Raises:

ValueError – If the customer is not found or the balance is insufficient.

Returns:

The updated wallet balance.

Return type:

float

services.customer_service.delete_customer(username)[source]

Delete a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to delete.

Raises:

ValueError – If the customer is not found.

services.customer_service.get_all_customers()[source]

Retrieve all customers.

Returns:

A list of all customer objects.

Return type:

list

services.customer_service.get_customer_by_username(username)[source]

Retrieve a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to retrieve.

Returns:

The customer object if found, else None.

Return type:

Customer

services.customer_service.register_customer(data, is_admin=False)[source]

Register a new customer.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing customer details such as full_name, username, password, age, address, gender, and marital_status.

  • is_admin (bool, optional) – Specifies if the customer is an admin. Defaults to False.

Raises:

ValueError – If a customer with the provided username already exists.

Returns:

The newly registered customer object.

Return type:

Customer

services.customer_service.update_customer(username, data)[source]

Update the details of a customer.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer to update.

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the fields to update.

Raises:

ValueError – If the customer is not found.

Returns:

The updated customer object.

Return type:

Customer
